ovdesc.p: Encompassed within the Funds Transfer Module is a fully operational Bulk Standing Orders application. In many respects it is similar to the Standing Order application, except of course it allows outgoing payments to be bulked together for different creditors from one account, i.e. one debit, lots of credits.

This will allow the user to load standing orders as Fixed Payments with a known amount. It is possible either to execute one-off payments or with an associated frequency (e.g. the monthly payment of staff salaries).

The application may be run on-line or as an end-of-day process. In order to run the Bulk Standing Orders on-line, there is a separate application called SINGLE.BULK.STO. For more details refer to the relevant help text.
The BULK.STO file has the standard 3 versions:

desc.p: This field determines the credit exposure date calculation rules. It accepts relative or absolute dates.
You can combine 1 or 2 date operations, always based on the frequency date, each operation being "+" or "-", followed by a number of days and followed by "C" or "W", meaning calendar or working days.
"+" and "C" are taken by default.
If number alone entered then it will be converted into valid date.
If nothing is entered here, default calculation will be done through the Funds Transfer calculation rules, depending on the payment method.
Examples :
"+01C-01W" which means "Last working day before the processing date"
"-02C" means processing date less 2 calendar days,
"01" entered when the system month/ year is Jan/2001, then it will convert to 01012001
and so on ...

Up to 8 type ANY (alphanumeric) characters. "+" and "C" are optional, and zeros will be added if needed. Example : "1-1W" will be taken as "+01C-01W". Optional input, blank means default FT calculation.
Identifies the current frequency of the Bulk Standing Order for the total amount specified in TOTAL.DEBIT.AMOUNT.

The Bulk Standing Order application will execute the standing order instruction according to the frequency specified in this field up to and including the CURRENT.END.DATE specified in the next field.

This field is sub-divided into two elements: 1. Date 1-9 type D (date format in range 1950-2049) characters. 2. Frequency 1-5 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character alpha) characters. Mandatory input or not allowed as defined in
Validation Rules:. No default.
Input mandatory if SINGLE.PAYMENT is set to 'NO'.
If SINGLE.PAYMENT is set to 'YES' then no input is allowed.
The date input will correspond to the first execution of the Bulk Standing Order.
The starting frequency must be greater than today.
An override will be required if the date input is a non-working day.

Contains the id of the frequency based bulk standing order from which this single one-off bulk standing order originates.

If for some reason the payment fails on a frequency based bulk standing order, a single payment bulk standing order is set up with the same details and written to the unauthorised file. The frequency based bulk standing order has it's frequency cycled forward as per normal but the single payment bulk standing order is set up so the operator may run it once the initial problem is solved, such as insufficient funds. This field which is only present on the single payment bulk standing order contains the id of the parent bulk standing order, i.e. the frequency based one.

Defines whether the Bulk Standing Order is a one-off single payment or frequency associated. Valid instructions are:
If the input is 'YES' then this means that it is a one-off transaction. This leads to fields CURRENT.FREQUENCY and CURRENT.END.DATE becoming non-input.
Conversely, if the input is 'NO' then SINGLE.PYMNT.DATE becomes non-input.
Y(ES) The Bulk Standing Order is a single payment N(O) The Bulk Standing Order is frequency associated. (Mandatory input)
Represents the ID by which each Bulk Standing Order is uniquely identified.
The ID can be Account No followed by automatically generated sequence or Account no with date separated by "-" and a automatically generated sequence.
If the Id is given with a a date, then it will be consider as a Single Payment Type of Bulk STO and the id date will be defaulted to single payment date. ID date has to be greater than today.
For a frequency based Bulk Standing order, the id has to be created with account no followed by automatically generated sequence number.
Hence for a same date using the sequence no, more than one Bulk Standing Orders can be created.

When the User wants to change an existing Bulk Standing Order, it will be necessary to enter the complete reference number i.e. the Account Number and the sequential Bulk Standing Order number separated by a . (dot) or Account number with date separted by "-" and "." sequential no.

2-24 type A (alphanumeric) characters as follows: - The first part of the ID will identify the Account Number for which the User wants to define Bulk Standing Order instructions. The format is the standard numeric Account Number or 3-10 character Account Mnemonic (uppercase alpha or numeric) - type MNE - The second part of the ID will be separated from the Account Number by a '.' and will be a three numeric characters sequential number. (Mandatory input)
During the creation of a new Bulk Standing Order the Account must be input as the System will always generate the next sequential Bulk Standing number.
If Date is entered as a part of ID, Id date defaulted as the Single payment date and ID date has to be greater than today.
For the Change function the User will need to enter the complete key including the sequential Bulk Standing Order itself.

Identifies any process errors or overrides that may have occurred on the individual payments.
If any errors or overrides are found on the main payment then, if the application is being run on-line, the User may input YES or NO to the override condition.
An input of NO will result in the Bulk Standing Order going to the Exception file, in which case it will need to be authorised in order to execute it again.
An input of YES will override the condition and execution will carry on and build the Funds Transfer records.

However if any of the individual payments encounter any overrides the Funds Transfer records will be built as normal, except they will have a Record Status of 'IHLD'. The actual override condition will be held in this field.
